message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product at a competitive price. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a valuable asset. I'm willing to sell it to you for $20,000.

Thank you for the offer, Alice.  While I appreciate your enthusiasm, $20,000 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with.  I'm willing to pay $14,000 for the product.  Let me know if that works for you.

I appreciate your offer, Bob, but I was hoping we could meet in the middle. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $17,000. This is a fair price considering the value it brings to you and the market demand.

Alice, I understand your desire to find a middle ground, but $17,000 is still a bit more than I'm comfortable with.  I'm willing to go up to $15,000.  This would be a fair deal for both of us, allowing you to get close to your desired price while keeping me within my budget.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $18,000. This is the minimum I'm willing to accept to make the deal worthwhile for me. If we can't meet at this price, I'm afraid I'll have to consider other options.
